noun.description: A member of a nomadic equestrian people from central Asia who built up a large kingdom in south-eastern Europe from the 6th century but were conquered by Charlemagne (791–9).
A member of a pastoral people of Dagestan in Russia, of uncertain relationship to the ancient Avars.
The North Caucasian language of the modern Avars.

adjective.description: Relating to the Avars or their language.
